results.title: Fanny and Alexander = Fanny och Alexander
results.creator_credit: Cinematograph for Svenska Filminstitutet, Gaumont-British Instructional, Personafilm, Tobis Filmkunst, Jorn Donner and Ingmar Bergman
results.brief_description: Swedish dialogue, English subtitles. This is a special two-part set containing the full length television version of Fanny and Alexander, running in total over 5 hours, 2 hours longer than the theatrical release version. Told through the eyes of a small boy, this most personal of Bergman’s works is both autobiographical and an artistic reference point. Set during turn-of- the-century Sweden, the story is about the well-to-do, loving and ebullient Ekdahl family. When the actor-father of 10 year old Alexander and 8 year old Fanny dies, their mother marries a sadistic minister. His cruelty leads Grandmother Eckdahl’s Jewish friend and lover to rescue them. Happiness and balance is restored. Announced as Bergman’s final film, it offers a superlative culmination of his 37 years as one of cinema’s greatest artists. Oscar Winner 1982 for Best Foreign Language Film, Best Cinematography, Best Art Direction and Best Costume Design. Stars Pernilla Allwin, Bertil Guve, Ewa Froling, Jan Malmsjo, Erland Josephson.

results.title: Fanny
results.brief_description:
Fanny has allowed Marius to leave her to become a sailor without telling him she was expecting his child. In order to avoid dishonor, Fanny’s mother, Honorine, is pushing the young woman to marry the wealthy and much older Panisse. Upon his return Marius learns about the wedding and the reason for so much haste. Careful to secure a future for ‘his’ grand son, Cesar, Marius’ father, persuades him to renounce any claim to the child. ‘Fanny’ is the second installement of Pagnol’s Marseille trilogy, started with ‘Marius’.

Credits: Producer, Roger Richebe ; director, Marc Allegret ; writer, Marcel Pagnol ; photography, Nicola Toporkoff ; music, Vincent Scotto, Georges Sellers ; producer’s assistants, Pierre Prevert, Yves Allegret.
Cast: Raimu, Orane Demazis, Pierre Fresnay, Fernand Charpin, Alida Rouffe.

results.title: Famous history of the life of King Henry the Eighth
results.brief_description: Shakespeare’s “The famous history of the life of Henry the eigth” featuring John Stride as Henry VIII and Claire Bloom as Catherine of Aragon. One of thirty-seven plays produced by the BBC over a period of six years.

results.title: Famous boundary of creation
results.brief_description: Documents the French-American study of the mid-Atlantic ridge. Illustrates plate tectonics. Underwater photography is used in this geological study. Photography includes, Iceland, Hawaii and Azores.

constellations_other.name: Reality TV me
constellations_other.description: Cult documentary Grey Gardens follows the everyday eccentricities of mother and daughter Big Edie and Little Edie. The women perform and speak candidly to the camera, and have been described as predecessors to reality TV stars.

results.title: Family Viewing
results.creator_credit: Ego Film Arts, Ontario Film Development Corporation, Canada Council, Ontario Arts Council and Atom Egoyan
results.brief_description: Atom Egoyan’s debut feature marked out the psychological landscape that he would pursue throughout his career - namely the dark undercurrents coursing beneath society’s veneer of calm and order, particularly in regards to sex and family. Van, an adolescent who lives with his remote father and dominated stepmother, is concerned for his grandmother who languishes in a shoddy elderly home. Despite Van’s protestations, his father neither visits nor cares causing Van to take action with the assistance of a woman, Aline, who visits her ailing mother in the next bed. As Van and Aline’s relationship develops, Van moves away from the incestuous bond he shares with his step-mother, as well as uncovering the secrets of his absent mother and domineering father. By framing characters in extreme close-up with continuous cross-cutting, mimicking the bland style of an ordinary day-time soap opera, Egoyan maintains a claustrophobic tension, an unsettling effect exacerbated by the devastating lies that lurk beneath such apparent ordinariness. Using a collection of video images, television, pornography, home movies, and surveillance the film observes the breakdown and restoration of a dislocated family. Cast includes: David Hemblen, Aidan Tierney, Gabrielle Rose, Arsinee Khanjian, Selma Keklikian, Rose Sarkisyan.

results.title: Family tree
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Tom Daly, George Dunning and Evelyn Lambart
results.brief_description: The story of the settlement of Canada, illustrated with cheerful animated cartoons. The arrival of Jacques Cartier, the fishing and fur trades which followed, and the rival colonization by the French and British, climaxed by the battle of the Plains of Abraham, are depicted. The coming of the United Empire Loyalists is seen; then the west-coast gold rush and the completion of the transcontinental railway. New branches were added to the family tree when many European settlers came to fill the great spaces of the Prairies. Finally, we see the whole country matured into a nation, its traditions enriched by those of many peoples.

results.title: Family Therapy(TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Open University, BBC-TV and Francis Sealey
results.brief_description: Looks at the way problems of individuals are often caused and maintained by their role in the family, Shows examples of some families in counselling sessions and the techniques used by therapists to help the family as a whole

results.title: Family reactions
results.creator_credit: Dept of Health, Richmond Implementation Unit, Tony Shaddock, Helen Edwards and Tim Abbott
results.brief_description: Designed to provide the intellectual disability residential care worker with an insight into what it means to be part of a family that includes a child with developmental disabilities, an understanding of the grieving process and how families cope, an appreciation of the needs of different families, to learn ways of interacting positively with parents, to examine methods of developing effective partnerships with parents and most importantly develop an appreciation of the uniqueness of families and their reactions. Accompanied by 44p. in-service training manual.
